Freedom Of Information: because democracy doesn't come cheap

A recently published report on the 2000 Freedom of Information Act, hints that the Justice Select Committee may have seen sense and quashed some of the restrictions suggested by politicians and many public bodies regarding our right to access information.

I heard 'G4S' is actually an acronym of 'Got Four Staff'

The land of milk and money

Supermarkets and farmers need to guarantee a minimum price for milk producers, or we risk losing domestically produced milk

Vladimir's PR cynics should be Putin their place

What is frustrating is not that Cameron chooses to channel resources into PR - politicians have always done this - it is that the British public drinks in this patriotic ambrosia

The NHS needs to stop playing God with our nation

The NHS should be concentrating on improving public confidence in the nation's healthcare, rather than giving up the unit as a bad job every time something goes wrong

I'm not asking for people to stop following and obsessing over him. But I am asking them to evaluate why exactly they do

From the mailbag: a PGWT response

Selling a manufactured illusion - Cartoon

By James Bithell

<img src="http://www.nouse.co.uk/wp-content/article_images/body/2012/06/Modernizationthumb.jpg"/>

University research should not be undermined - Cartoon

By James Bithell

<img src="http://www.nouse.co.uk/wp-content/article_images/body/2012/06/biologycartoonthumb.png"/>

Bigger isn't always better - Cartoon

By James Bithell

<img src="http://www.nouse.co.uk/wp-content/article_images/body/2012/06/York-2015thumb.jpg"/>

Assessment of postgraduate pay must be realistic - Cartoon

By James Bithell

<img src="http://www.nouse.co.uk/wp-content/article_images/body/2012/06/PGWT-Cartoon-thumb.jpg" />

Selling a manufactured illusion

Most importantly we need to ask what this technology can really bring to the University, it's teaching, and the first-class research conducted. Without playing up to the old-fashioned professor stereotype, how many of the researchers and professors, for whom this technology was bought, will know how to take full advantage of all this innovation can offer?

Assessment of postgraduate pay must be realistic

To all students, the issue of money is a case of putting up without while doing what you (hopefully) love. Of course, many students hope they will be reimbursed for their skint years of student-hood in later years

Bigger isn't always better

One of York's best selling points is the small, campus community, but an unrestrained growth strategy would leave York in danger of losing this

Immigration law a step in the right direction

Immigration has always been a contentious issue, and Theresa May's new plans for deportation are about to make it even more so

University research should not be undermined

Although the sheer scale of the numbers of animals killed by animal testing at the University might come as a shock to many, it must not be forgotten that this has become an accepted, and possibly essential, practice in modern society

Rejection is the first step to acceptance

If you're reading this, chances are you're a student at The University of York, or that garishly tattooed bloke who always hangs around The Courtyard

YUSU strategy: gate-crashing the AA

To get more people involved, YUSU needs to make the policy process more interesting, comprehensible, and accessible

Accommodation lottery is the fairest of them all

Previously described as "the worst system seen at one of the best universities" and "an unfair lottery", the University of York's application process for accommodation has left a lot to be desired

Decriminalisation needs open, frank discussion

Authoritarian approaches to recreational drug use will solve little. Education and discussion are the way forward

Sorting out the collegiate system

As the University continues to expand onto Heslington East, it is becoming clear that we need to develop distinct personalities for each of our colleges

Expensive toys are no use to students

Donkeys of the department?

Hasta luego

Framing Gays: DC's queer sensationalism

The inclusion of homosexuality in the Green Lantern's character profile is not 'incidental' as it claims to be. It was reactionary and a tool of hype

We cannot fight ignorance with ignorance

Much of the uproar about Chambers' visit is focused on the perceived danger to students, that the University has a duty to protect students from extremist views. This in itself is not only frustratingly patronising, but also dangerous

QAA review should not be ignored

Housing law should be opposed

The Mediterranean state of the library
